question: Which institute first time releases guidelines on child sex abuse?
option4: All India medical Institute of technology
explanation: The World Health Organisation (WHO) for first time formulated clinical guidelines on responding to children and adolescents who have been sexually abused. The guidelines are grounded in human rights standards and ethical principles. They will assist frontline health care providers general practitioners, gynaecologists, nurses and others who may directly receive victim of sexual abuse or may identify sexual abuse during the course.
